timeline.bodyText: Since we already have logic like this in the Rule class, I think we should find a common place for this validation that they both use.

replies.bodyText:
Thanks for suggestion
I think I'll move duplicated logic to a static method, maybe under GasLimitRangeAndDeltaValidationRule?
replies.author: AtkinsChang

timeline.bodyText: GasLimitRangeAndDeltaValidationRule checks that the min gas limit is above the divisor and doesn't accept it. Your ammendent of this test seems to suggest that it should be allowed, but it causes the adjustment to be 0 in perpetuity. Do you have a source for this behavior? I see that when I search gas limit here, it seems to say that 5000 is the minimum: https://ethereum.github.io/yellowpaper/paper.pdf
timeline.author: RatanRSur

replies.bodyText: Yes this would never happen in the integrated scenario, but this test case is originally try to test the negative situation (which won't happen). Do you suggest to remove this test case?
replies.author: AtkinsChang

replies.bodyText: I think we should replace it with a test that tests the 5000 gas scenario
replies.author: RatanRSur

replies.bodyText: (ensures that it doesn't go below that value)
replies.author: RatanRSur

replies.bodyText:
5000 is based on the consensus algorithm (ex IBFT)
But I can change TargetingGasLimitCalculator to enforce a 5000 minimum
replies.author: AtkinsChang

replies.bodyText: Oh yeah, I should clarify that I meant a general "minimum" like in GasLimitRangeAndDeltaValidationRule, not necessarily 5000 hardcoded. As you can see, the TargetingGasLimitCalculator should rely on the validation rule class heavily since all that logic is already there.
replies.author: RatanRSur

One thing which might make the code look closer to what we're going after conceptually is the use of google guava's Range class.
